poem:
The Wake-Up Call

At 2am, the bells startle the sky,  
chiming chaos into the ears of the sleeping.  
Father Giovanni, conductor of clang,  
in crucible rain, awakens the village—  
a symphony of warning,  
notes rippling through dreams,  
as water rises uninvited,  
and night learns the language of flood.
